How to use
Fill me in please! Don’t forget code examples:

1+1

2

title: 1.7 Russel’s paradox in Python
text:
The barber is the “one who shaves all those, and those only, who do not shave themselves”. The question is, does the barber shave himself?
We want to create a test that doesn’t contain itself. For that, we need a membership test.

title: 1.7 Russel’s paradox in Python
section: Annex: My initial attemps on FizzBuzz
text:
Annex: My initial attemps on FizzBuzz
This test has been mentioned in the video. Quick implementation.
Description: - si le nombre est divisible par 3 : on écrit Fizz - si le nombre est divisible par 5 : on écrit Buzz - si le nombre est divisible par 3 et par 5 : on écrit Fizzbuzz - sinon : on écrit le nombre

def multipleOf(n): return lambda m: m % n == 0


multipleOf3 = multipleOf(3)
multipleOf5 = multipleOf(5)


# v1
def fizzBuzz(n):
    if multipleOf3(n):
        if multipleOf5(n):
            return 'FizzBuzz'
        else:
            return 'Fizz'
    else:
        if multipleOf5(n):
            return 'Buzz'
        else:
            return n


# v2
def fizzBuzz(n):
    if not (multipleOf3(n) or multipleOf5(n)): return n
    fizz = 'Fizz' if multipleOf3(n) else ''
    buzz = 'Buzz' if multipleOf5(n) else ''
    return fizz + buzz


for i in range(1, 101):
    print(f'{i} -> {fizzBuzz(i)}')

# So, Don's implementation of FizzBuzz
for i in range(100):
    if i in FizzBuzz:
        print('FizzBuzz')
    elif i in Fizz:
        print('Fizz')
    elif i in Buzz:
        print('Buzz')
    else:
        print(i)
